name: Soccer Mix Trivia Quiz | Soccer | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who was the first person to have played in a Mersyside, Manchester and Old Firm football derby?
questions.explanation:
Andrei Kanchelskis.

	Kanchelskis played for Rangers, Manchester United and Everton in the derby games. He was the first player to acheive this feat. The seocnd was Craig Bellamy.

questions.text: Who were the first team to win the World Cup twice in a row?
questions.explanation:
Italy.

	Uruguay won the first World Cup in 1930, but Italy won the next two World Cups in 1934 and 1938.

questions.text: Which of the following was the youngest player to play in the World Cup finals?
questions.explanation:
Norman Whiteside.

	Pele was the youngest player to play in a World Cup, however, Whiteside was the youngest to play at the finals. Theo Walcott never actually played a game for England.

questions.text: What was the first year that British countries played in the World Cup / Jules Rimet?
questions.explanation:
1950.

	The first British country to compete in the Jules Rimet finals was England in 1950. They faced Scotland in a playoff to see who would play at the finals. England won while Scotland stayed at home.

questions.text: Which is the odd one out?
questions.explanation:
Petrescu.

	Petrescu is the odd one out. The rest have all been World Cup mascots. Petrescu was a Romanian player who used to play for Chelsea.

questions.text: Which of the following has scored more goals at a World Cup finals?
questions.explanation:
Just Fontaine.

	Just Fontaine scored 13 goals in 6 games in 1958. Despite this incredible acheivement, France managed only a third place finish.

questions.text: Who was the first non-English team to lift the FA Cup?
questions.explanation:
Cardiff.

	Cardiff won the Cup in 1927. They beat Arsenal 1-0 after a Hugh Ferguson goal.

questions.text: Who scored the first goal in Premiership history?
questions.explanation:
Brian Deane.

	Brian Deane scored first for Sheffield United against Manchester United. Unfortunately, the Red Devils came back to win 3-2 with McClair scoring.

questions.text: Which of the following was the first team to win 50 Scottish league titles?
questions.explanation:
Rangers.

	The Rangers reached the 50-plateau in 2002-03.

questions.text: What stadium do the Republic of Ireland play their home games at after moving from Landsdown Road?
questions.explanation:
Croke Park.

	The Republic play at Croke Park after switching from Landsdown Road in 2007. England play at Wembley and Northern Ireland play at Windsor Park.
